verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764>, even to Jeduthun <WH3038>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. I said <WH559> <WH8804>, I will take heed <WH8104> <WH8799> to my ways <WH1870>, that I sin <WH2398> <WH8800> not with my tongue <WH3956>: I will keep <WH8104> <WH8799> my mouth <WH6310> with a bridle <WH4269>, while the wicked <WH7563> is before me.
I was dumb <WH481> <WH8738> with silence <WH1747>, I held my peace <WH2814> <WH8689>, even from good <WH2896>; and my sorrow <WH3511> was stirred <WH5916> <WH8738>.
My heart <WH3820> was hot <WH2552> <WH8804> within <WH7130> me, while I was musing <WH1901> the fire <WH784> burned <WH1197> <WH8799>: then <WH227> spake <WH1696> <WH8765> I with my tongue <WH3956>,
YY <WH3068>, make me to know <WH3045> <WH8685> mine end <WH7093>, and the measure <WH4060> of my days <WH3117>, what it is; that I may know <WH3045> <WH8799> how frail <WH2310> I am.

Behold, thou hast made <WH5414> <WH8804> my days <WH3117> as an handbreadth <WH2947>; and mine age <WH2465> is as nothing before thee: verily every <WH3605> man <WH120> at his best state <WH5324> <WH8737> is altogether <WH3605> vanity <WH1892>. Selah <WH5542>.

Surely every man <WH376> walketh <WH1980> <WH8691> in a vain shew <WH6754>: surely they are disquieted <WH1993> <WH8799> in vain <WH1892>: he heapeth up <WH6651> <WH8799> riches, and knoweth <WH3045> <WH8799> not who shall gather <WH622> <WH8802> them.
And now, YY <WH136>, what wait <WH6960> <WH8765> I for? my hope <WH8431> is in thee.
Deliver <WH5337> <WH8685> me from all my transgressions <WH6588>: make <WH7760> <WH8799> me not the reproach <WH2781> of the foolish <WH5036>.
I was dumb <WH481> <WH8738>, I opened <WH6605> <WH8799> not my mouth <WH6310>; because thou didst <WH6213> <WH8804> it.
Remove <WH5493> thy stroke <WH5061> away <WH5493> <WH8685> from me: I am consumed <WH3615> <WH8804> by the blow <WH8409> of thine hand <WH3027>.

When thou with rebukes <WH8433> dost correct <WH3256> <WH8765> man <WH376> for iniquity <WH5771>, thou makest his beauty <WH2530> <WH8803> to consume away <WH4529> <WH8686> like a moth <WH6211>: surely every man <WH120> is vanity <WH1892>. Selah <WH5542>.

Hear <WH8085> <WH8798> my prayer <WH8605>, O YY <WH3068>, and give ear <WH238> <WH8685> unto my cry <WH7775>; hold not thy peace <WH2790> <WH8799> at my tears <WH1832>: for I am a stranger <WH1616> with thee, and a sojourner <WH8453>, as all my fathers <WH1> were.
O spare <WH8159> <WH8685> me, that I may recover strength <WH1082> <WH8686>, before I go hence <WH3212> <WH8799>, and be no more.
